newsitem.title: RUSSIA: ONAKO plans international issue in 1997.
newsitem.headline: ONAKO plans international issue in 1997.

text.p: Orenburgskaya Neftyanaya Aktsionernaya Kompaniya (ONAKO) plans to issue shares on international markets by the middle of next year, a senior company official said on Tuesday.

"We intend to do this in a completely civilised way. Either by issuing ADRs under rule 144a, or otherwise," ONAKO vice-president for economics and finance Alexander Aleshin told a securities market conference.
"We are already working on this and count on being successful."

The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) allows non-U.S. companies to place shares with institutional buyers, as in a private placement, under looser compliance and disclosure rules than normal, under its rule 144a.
This type of ADR allows a company to raise new capital when it places its shares, and not simply place existing shares with a new circle of investors.
ONAKO has enlisted Coopers & Lybrand to audit its books and decided to undertake an audit of its reserves to international standards, he said.
ONAKO is one of a dozen vertically integrated Russian oil groups created over the last few years. Its main operating unit is Orenburgneft.
